class="article-dek"><p class="">Timex resurrects one of their first quartz watches.</p></h2>  </div>  <div class="article-meta" data-article-ctrl="breakpoint">    <div class="article-meta__inner">        <div class="byline">    <div class="author-avatars">          <img style="height: 34px; width: 34px; background: #000">    </div>    <div class="author-names">          <address class="byline-author">            <a class="byline-author-link" data-member-id="eefc8750-c5a8-416e-9914-91643c5a68bf" href="/members/Cole">              <span class="byline-author-name" id="034jnnaoz">                Cole Pennington              </span></a>          </address>      <div class="article-dateline" id="3nykinyus">          May 16, 2019      </div>    </div>  </div>      <div class="social-icons-wrap hide-until-desktopNarrow">        <ul class="social-icons">  <li class="social-icons-item">  	<a class="social-icons-item-share" data-channel="facebook" href="https://www.facebook.com/dialog/feed?app_id=992227144174266&display=page&link=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hodinkee.com%2Farticles%2Fq-timex&redirect_uri=https://www.hodinkee.com/articles/q-timex" data-channel="twitter" href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Introducing+The+Q+Timex+https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hodinkee.com%2Farticles%2Fq-timex+via+%40HODINKEE" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"><svg href="http://www.pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hodinkee.com%2Farticles%2Fq-timex&media=https://hodinkee.imgix.net/uploads/images/1557803247128-vcaieyjn0ch-86a3c7ce4f6993d0e53cf19036cbb30d/B89A0266hero.jpg?ixlib=rails-1.1.0&s=d44c592e29fb28192119f24e052b7fbc&description=The Q Timex" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"><svg class="icon icon-pinterest"><use xlink:href="#icon-pinterest"></use></svg></a>  </li>  <li class="social-icons-item">  	<a class="social-icons-item-share" data-channel="email" href="mailto:?to=&subject=The Q Timex&body=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hodinkee.com%2Farticles%2Fq-timex" rel="nofollow"><svg class="icon icon-share-arrow"><use width: 33px; background: #000">            <span class="comment-count">193</span>          </a>        </div>    </div>  </div></div><div class="article-content">    <div class="article-blocks">        <div data-index="0">            <div class="ad-block ad-block--square_breaker hide-on-empty" style="">    <div class="ad-title ad-square-title" style="">ADVERTISEMENT</div>      <div id="72452" class="google-ad" data-ad-load="" data-ad-type="articleSquareMobileOnlyAd" data-ad-targeting="[{"Category":"product-launch"}]" style=""></div>  </div>        </div>        <div data-index="1">          <div class="headline headline-h3">	Quick Take</div>        </div>        <div data-index="2">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>Timex is back with a modern re-edition of a watch that represented a major pivot for the American watchmaker. The Q Timex is an almost 1:1 reproduction of an original model, right down to the screw-in battery hatch. Remember those? </p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="3">          <div class="inline-image-container block--small">  <div class="embed-img" data-src="https://hodinkee.imgix.net/uploads/images/1557803889948-6f9mpc1hfhs-e604686fc4a548a8d8778612580c74b6/B89A0295.jpg?ixlib=rails-1.1.0&fit=crop&ch=Width%2CDPR%2CSave-Data&alt=&fm=jpg&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&s=7d11d12f306c4a94673489e71e9b8500" data-width="2000" data-height="1333">    <img style="height: 453.156px; width: 680px; background: #000"></div></div>        </div>        <div data-index="4">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>It was 1979, and the horological world was in the midst of a massive change. Quartz movements had rocked the industry, and the shift had created market circumstances where it made sense for American brands like Hamilton to sell their name and IP to foreign corporations. Timex and Bulova remained American in ‘79, but in order to stay afloat they had to create products that went with the current trends, and that meant producing quartz watches. </p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="5">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>Enter the Q Timex. The first quartz watch from Timex was produced in 1972, and by the time this model was released in 1979 it was clear that quartz was here to stay. Not only did it follow the quartz trend, it adopted some major design elements that had come to define the ‘70s, too, with a woven stainless steel bracelet, squared-off and beveled case, and a GMT Master-inspired bezel (which on the Q rotates, non-ratcheting, in both directions). The Q watches proudly displayed “Q” branding at 12 o'clock to let everyone know that everyman Timex watches had officially moved into the quartz era. </p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="6">          <div class="inline-image-container block--large">  <div class="embed-img" data-src="https://hodinkee.imgix.net/uploads/images/1557803937367-vpksgpe7np-8ff961edd22a7c8be850cfae0143f365/B89A0277.jpg?ixlib=rails-1.1.0&fit=crop&ch=Width%2CDPR%2CSave-Data&alt=&fm=jpg&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&s=766500da9ddb4f5dc1044b56b1e3a46d" data-width="2000" data-height="1333">    <img style="height: 566.484px; width: 850px; background: #000"></div></div>        </div>        <div data-index="7">          <div class="headline headline-h3">	Initial Thoughts</div>        </div>        <div data-index="8">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>The watch is priced at an approachable $179, and I think that’s a price point that folks can appreciate more than the $495 for the American Documents series released recently. Timex has built a reputation on being <i>the</i> affordable American watch for everyone, and that’s where this modern Q shines. You get an iconic pepsi color scheme, which is pre-contextualized for first time watch buyers as being "cool" thanks to the Rolex GMT-Master, and on top of that, it’s an accurate re-edition of an important watch.</p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="9">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>The first mainstream quartz watch from Timex is a big deal;  it represents a massive shift in the horological <i>Weltanschauung</i> of late ‘70s. When quartz watches first came out, they were hugely <a href="https://www.hodinkee.com/articles/four-revolutions-quartz-revolution"><u>expensive and an absolute marvel.</u></a> That was in 1969 (the Seiko Astron, of course) and by the time Timex, known for affordable watches, came out with the Q, it was clear: Quartz watches were now accessible and they would become the standard going forward. If a company like Timex was doing it, it was here to stay. </p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="10">          <div class="inline-image-container block--small">  <div class="embed-img" data-src="https://hodinkee.imgix.net/uploads/images/1557803912284-luophlv5xb-bc894b82b735b4fe555976d821505cf4/B89A0286.jpg?ixlib=rails-1.1.0&fit=crop&ch=Width%2CDPR%2CSave-Data&alt=&fm=jpg&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&s=b889469d8062fdba762935f094da48ef" data-width="2000" data-height="1333">    <img style="height: 453.156px; width: 680px; background: #000"></div></div>        </div>        <div data-index="11">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>The Q looks like a Rolex GMT-Master, and that’s not by accident. During the era the original Q  was made, it was totally commonplace for brands at affordable price points to ape design cues from more prestigious brands at higher price points. Couldn’t afford a Rolex back in '79? That’s okay, Timex was your way in. The reasoning behind re-introducing this watch in 2019, according to the designer Giorgio Galli, is to introduce this current younger generation of watch buyers to what Timex used to be. In other words, it’s just as much to educate consumers about Timex’s past as it is to celebrate the brands heritage. And the purpose really hasn’t changed, it’s still to get folks into the world of watches by offering something that’s affordable and looks pretty darn good. </p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="12">          <div class="inline-image-container block--large">  <div class="embed-img" data-src="https://hodinkee.imgix.net/uploads/images/1557803957541-jb51865yw8q-b95f47003283fb76d9ff299507a1b0ca/B89A0312.jpg?ixlib=rails-1.1.0&fit=crop&ch=Width%2CDPR%2CSave-Data&alt=&fm=jpg&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&s=75a816830298541125e6b4c50398ee43" data-width="2000" data-height="1333">    <img style="height: 566.484px; width: 850px; background: #000"></div></div>        </div>        <div data-index="13">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p>Engineering and machining technology have come such a long way since the late ‘70s that the new steel woven bracelet actually wears nicely, as opposed to the often flimsy feeling of the old ones. The battery hatch is a novel touch as well. Some of us may be able to recall taking a dime and unscrewing the battery lid, popping out the lithium battery and trying to decipher the model number only to find that the local drug store didn’t even carry it. (To make life easier, the type of battery you'll need is stamped on the battery hatch: a standard 377 button cell). Changing your own watch battery is a ceremony that most younger watch enthusiasts haven't had the opportunity to experience. Maybe now they'll have something to look forward to when the watch stops ticking. </p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="14">            <div class="ad-block ad-block--right_rail hide-on-empty" style="">    <div class="ad-title ad-square-title" style="">ADVERTISEMENT</div>      <div id="72453" class="google-ad" data-ad-load="" data-ad-type="articleSquareAd" data-ad-targeting="[{"Category":"product-launch"}]" style=""></div>  </div>        </div>        <div data-index="15">          <div class="headline headline-h2">		<hr class="headline-hr">	The Basics</div>        </div>        <div data-index="16">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p><strong>Brand:</strong> Timex<br><strong>Model:</strong> Q Timex<br><strong>Reference Number: </strong>TW2T80700</p><p><strong>Diameter:</strong> 38mm<br><strong>Thickness:</strong> 11.5mm<br><strong>Case Material:</strong> Stainless Steel<br><strong>Dial Color:</strong> Navy Blue<br><strong>Indexes:</strong> Printed<br><strong>Lume:</strong> Index, HH / MH<br><strong>Water Resistance:</strong> 50M<br><strong>Strap/Bracelet: </strong>Stainless bracelet reverse engineered from the original design</p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="17">          <div class="inline-image-container block--small">  <div class="embed-img" data-src="https://hodinkee.imgix.net/uploads/images/1557803795832-jw3xmp51gcr-53dfbd1842144f4ec2676412611edc67/B89A0301.jpg?ixlib=rails-1.1.0&fit=crop&ch=Width%2CDPR%2CSave-Data&alt=&fm=jpg&q=55&auto=format&usm=12&s=68811db871abb95d44df5f268dc10419" data-width="2000" data-height="1333">    <img style="height: 453.156px; width: 680px; background: #000"></div></div>        </div>        <div data-index="18">          <div class="headline headline-h2">		<hr class="headline-hr">	The Movement</div>        </div>        <div data-index="19">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p><strong>Caliber:</strong> PC33 (Seiko)<br><strong>Functions:</strong> Time, Date, Day of week in English or Spanish<br><strong>Diameter:</strong> Outside diameter 22.60mm x 22.00mm x 23.70mm<br><strong>Thickness:</strong> 4.15 mm (including the battery)</p></div>        </div>        <div data-index="20">            <div class="ad-block ad-block--right_rail hide-on-empty" style="">    <div class="ad-title ad-square-title" style="">ADVERTISEMENT</div>      <div id="72454" class="google-ad" data-ad-load="" data-ad-type="articleSquareAd" data-ad-targeting="[{"Category":"product-launch"}]" style=""></div>  </div>        </div>        <div data-index="21">          <div class="headline headline-h2">		<hr class="headline-hr">	Pricing & Availability</div>        </div>        <div data-index="22">          <div class="body-copy ">	<p><strong>Price:</strong> $179<br><strong>Availability:</strong> May 16th on Timex.com, select retailers thereafter</p><p> For more <a href="https://www.timex.com/" rel="noopener" target="_blank">click here</a>.</p></div>        </div>    <div class="article-tags">    <div class="article-tag">      <a data-tag="timex" href="/search/tag/timex">Timex</a>    </div></div> width: 40px; background: #000"></a></div><div class="comment__meta"><div class="comment__meta__user-info"><a href="/members/Buschyfor3" class="comment__meta__username">Buschyfor3</a><span class="comment__meta--dates"><i class="bullet hide-until-desktopNarrow">·</i><a href="#comment-104788"><time class="timeago" datetime="2019-05-17T14:07:13.000Z">a day ago</time></a></span></div><div class="comment__meta__clear hide-from-tablet" style=""></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment__pending-badge" style="">Pending Approval</div><div class="comment__body"><p>My guess is that it will be restocked for two reasons: 1) because it sold out so quick, Timex probably realizes they have a winner on their hands; width: 75px; background: #000"></a></div><h3 class="member-hovercard__member-name"><a href="/members/duder13">duder13</a></h3><p class="member-hovercard__member-bio"></p><p class="member-hovercard__member-extras"></p></div><a href="/members/duder13"><img style="height: 50px; Quartz? Timex? GMT rip-off, 12 hour bezel? Who cares!!  This is one of those rare watches that’s so fantastic looking that it makes you throw all of your usual critiques out the window. Super cool and an instant buy.</p></div><div class="comment__actions"><span class="comment__actions__vote"><a href="#" class=""><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-heart"></use></svg>   <span>18 Likes</span></a></span><span>    </span><span><a href="#">Reply</a></span></div></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment-children comment-children--nested depth-0"></div></div></div><div class="comment comment--group-container" id="comment-104750"><div class="comment__container"><div class="comment__toggle-children"><a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-dropdown-arrow"></use></svg></a></div><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><div class="member-hovercard"><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><a href="/members/zwer"><img style="height: 75px; width: 75px; background: #000"></a></div><h3 class="member-hovercard__member-name"><a href="/members/zwer">zwer</a></h3><p class="member-hovercard__member-bio"></p><p class="member-hovercard__member-extras"></p></div><a href="/members/zwer"><img style="height: 50px; width: 50px; background: #000"></a></div><div class="comment__meta"><div class="comment__meta__user-info"><a href="/members/zwer" class="comment__meta__username">zwer</a><span class="comment__meta--dates"><i class="bullet hide-until-desktopNarrow">·</i><a href="#comment-104750"><time class="timeago" datetime="2019-05-17T13:04:49.000Z">a day ago</time></a></span></div><div class="comment__meta__clear hide-from-tablet" style=""></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment__pending-badge" style="">Pending Approval</div><div class="comment__body"><p>Looks like there will be a lot of new Timexes sitting in the back of socks drawers in a month. Not sure what the appeal is here. A quartz watch with a derivative bezel and...a battery hatch. For $179, they could have added GMT functionality, which would’ve been something worth writing about. But as it stands, don’t believe the hype.</p></div><div class="comment__actions"><span class="comment__actions__vote"><a href="#" class=""><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-heart"></use></svg>   </a></span><span>    </span><span><a href="#">Reply</a></span></div></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment-children comment-children--nested depth-0"><div class="comment" id="comment-104810"><div class="comment__container comment__container--nested"><div class="comment__toggle-children"><a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-dropdown-arrow"></use></svg></a></div><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><div class="member-hovercard"><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><a href="/members/duder13"><img style="height: 75px; width: 75px; background: #000"></a></div><h3 class="member-hovercard__member-name"><a href="/members/duder13">duder13</a></h3><p class="member-hovercard__member-bio"></p><p class="member-hovercard__member-extras"></p></div><a href="/members/duder13"><img style="height: 40px; width: 40px; background: #000"></a></div><div class="comment__meta"><div class="comment__meta__user-info"><a href="/members/duder13" class="comment__meta__username">duder13</a><span class="comment__meta--dates"><i class="bullet hide-until-desktopNarrow">·</i><a href="#comment-104810"><time class="timeago" datetime="2019-05-17T15:06:04.000Z">a day ago</time></a></span></div><div class="comment__meta__clear hide-from-tablet" style=""></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment__pending-badge" style="">Pending Approval</div><div class="comment__body"><p>Like it or not, ‘70s quartz has become cool, and this is nearly a 1:1 copy of a 40 year old quartz, but with a better movement and stainless steel. I recently purchased the Timex “City” collection, a Rolex Explorer homage as far as I can tell. Great watch for the price and specs. But the GMT is way overpriced for what they are giving you. You don’t get enough watch for the 495.00 price tag on the documents edition as well. The Marlin? $140.00 at best. So I like them digging in the crates for the old stuff but man let’s get some of things sold first and then reviewed by the community before you starting introducing higher price points for lets just be honest, a brand that offers good product for a reasonable price. There is a hundred automatic seiko 5’s under $150.00..<a href="http://.just" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">.just</a> saying.</p></div><div class="comment__actions"><span class="comment__actions__vote"><a href="#" class=""><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-heart"></use></svg>   </a></span><span>    </span><span><a href="#">Reply</a></span></div></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment-children comment-children--nested depth-0"><div class="comment" id="comment-104537"><div class="comment__container comment__container--nested"><div class="comment__toggle-children"><a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-dropdown-arrow"></use></svg></a></div><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><div class="member-hovercard"><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><a href="/members/Boman"><img style="height: 75px; Just one small correction: " it represents a massive shift in the horological Weltanschauung of late ‘70s. When quartz watches first came out, they were hugely expensive and an absolute marvel. That was about twenty years earlier.. " It was less than ten years earlier. The first quartz watches by Seiko and the Swiss consortium made up of the "big names" had quartz watches by 1970, though were massively expensive and available in very limited numbers. They only started to come down to affordable prices by around 72/73 and really got going for Mr and Mrs Everyman by around 77 and they were mostly Japanese digitals. It was more them(and a switch in exchange rates) and not quartz itself that sank the Swiss, as they missed the boat early on with digitals(which was originally an American innovation).</p></div><div class="comment__actions"><span class="comment__actions__vote"><a href="#" class=""><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-heart"></use></svg>   <span>1 Like</span></a></span><span>    </span><span><a href="#">Reply</a></span></div></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment-children comment-children--nested depth-0"><div class="comment" id="comment-104528"><div class="comment__container comment__container--nested"><div class="comment__toggle-children"><a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-dropdown-arrow"></use></svg></a></div><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><div class="member-hovercard"><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><a href="/members/JackForster"><img style="height: 75px; I think that what I appreciate is Hodinkee's willingness to write an article about a watch that costs under $200. To me that gives some validation to collectors who simply aren't able to purchase a Rolex or something else around that price point.</p></div><div class="comment__actions"><span class="comment__actions__vote"><a href="#" class=""><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-heart"></use></svg>   <span>16 Likes</span></a></span><span>    </span><span><a href="#">Reply</a></span></div></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment-children comment-children--nested depth-0"></div></div></div><div class="comment comment--group-container" id="comment-104508"><div class="comment__container"><div class="comment__toggle-children"><a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-dropdown-arrow"></use></svg></a></div><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><div class="member-hovercard"><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><a href="/members/Buschyfor3"><img style="height: 75px; width: 75px; background: #000"></a></div><h3 class="member-hovercard__member-name"><a href="/members/Buschyfor3">Buschyfor3</a></h3><p class="member-hovercard__member-bio">Just trying to absorb knowledge about watches and horology like a sponge absorbs water.</p><p class="member-hovercard__member-extras">The Bluegrass State</p></div><a href="/members/Buschyfor3"><img style="height: 50px; width: 50px; background: #000"></a></div><div class="comment__meta"><div class="comment__meta__user-info"><a href="/members/Buschyfor3" class="comment__meta__username">Buschyfor3</a><span class="comment__meta--dates"><i class="bullet hide-until-desktopNarrow">·</i><a href="#comment-104508"><time class="timeago" datetime="2019-05-16T16:59:56.000Z">2 days ago</time></a></span></div><div class="comment__meta__clear hide-from-tablet" style=""></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment__pending-badge" style="">Pending Approval</div><div class="comment__body"><p>My first watch when I was a kiddo was a Timex Expedition - it's a right of passage of sorts, I suppose.Either way, this is positioned to be a nice, no-frills beater watch.  It looks nice enough, while remaining inexpensive such that if you ding, dent or  scratch it up - or if it outright buys the farm - it wouldn't break your heart or your pocketbook in the process.My only qualm would be that I would prefer a stronger WR rating for an all-rounder, but for $179 there's really not much room for complaints.</p></div><div class="comment__actions"><span class="comment__actions__vote"><a href="#" class=""><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-heart"></use></svg>   </a></span><span>    </span><span><a href="#">Reply</a></span></div></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment-children comment-children--nested depth-0"></div></div></div><div class="comment comment--group-container" id="comment-104507"><div class="comment__container"><div class="comment__toggle-children"><a href="#"><svg class="icon"><use xlink:href="#icon-dropdown-arrow"></use></svg></a></div><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><div class="member-hovercard"><div class="comment__meta__avatar"><a href="/members/marchone"><img style="height: 75px; width: 75px; background: #000"></a></div><h3 class="member-hovercard__member-name"><a href="/members/marchone">marchone</a></h3><p class="member-hovercard__member-bio"></p><p class="member-hovercard__member-extras"></p></div><a href="/members/marchone"><img style="height: 50px; width: 50px; background: #000"></a></div><div class="comment__meta"><div class="comment__meta__user-info"><a href="/members/marchone" class="comment__meta__username">marchone</a><span class="comment__meta--dates"><i class="bullet hide-until-desktopNarrow">·</i><a href="#comment-104507"><time class="timeago" datetime="2019-05-16T16:48:02.000Z">2 days ago</time></a></span></div><div class="comment__meta__clear hide-from-tablet" style=""></div></div><div class="comment__collapsable"><div class="comment__pending-badge" style="">Pending Approval</div><div class="comment__body"><p>I prefer it over anything Swatch does.
